page.title: 09MONT ORGUEIL CASTLE (8)
page.content:
There my tour ends, and I hope that you enjoyed it as I did. My favourite part was reaching the top and taking in the magnificent view over Gorey harbour and the Island to the west, St. Catherine's Bay, and the Royal Bay of Grouville, with yachts dotted here and there on its calm blue sea. And all along the horizon to the east the coast of France. I could almost imagine that I was one of those archers, hundreds of years ago, watching through the slits for the French, and helping to keep our castle and Island from their clutches.
The castle figures prominently as one of the major tourist attractions in the island and receives more than 100,000 visitors every season.
